info.title: BMATIC API
info.description:
Welcome to the BMATIC API! You can use our API to integrate your application with us. Now, trought our endpoints you can access to services of BMATIC's branches from any application.


The BMATIC API uses HTTP methods and a RESTful endpoint structure. The API authorization framework is OAuth 2.0. You format requests in JSON and the API return JSON-formatted responses. 


Improve your customers' experience!

get.description: Returns all branches that fulfill the filters. Support to getting of branches by the customer location. When the parameters longitude and latitude were recived, the branches are sorted by the better distance to client location and the branches in the page returned are sorted by the more short estimated waiting time; else the branches only are sorted by the more short estimated waiting time.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Latitude component of customer location.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Longitude component of customer location.

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: Maximum distance from the customer location to the branch, per example 1000 meters.

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of service requested by customer.

parameters.name: is_virtual
parameters.description: Flag of virtual ticket enable for branch.

parameters.name: is_bookable
parameters.description: Flag of booking enable for branch.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of branch.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Entity fields that will return at response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Position in pagination. Default is zero.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to retrieve. Default is 10, maximum is 50.

404.description: Non exists branches that fulfill the filters.

get.description: Returns a specific branch requested by ID.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of branch.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Entity fields that will return at response.

get.description: Returns all sectors of a specific branch that fulfill the filters. The sectors are sorted by their name.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of branch.

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of service requested by customer.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of sector.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Entity fields that will return at response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Position in pagination. Default is zero.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to retrieve. Default is 10, maximum is 50.

404.description: Non exists sectors that fulfill the filters.

get.description: Returns a specific sector of a branch.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of branch.

parameters.name: sector_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of sector.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Entity fields that will return at response.

get.description: Returns all available services that fulfill the filters. The services are sorted by their name.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of branch.

parameters.name: sector_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of sector.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Entity fields that will return at response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Position in pagination. Default is zero.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to retrieve. Default is 10, maximum is 50.

404.description: Non exists available services that fulfill the filters.

get.description: Returns a specific service requested by ID.

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of service.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Entity fields that will return at response.

post.description: Create a new customer booking and then it returns it.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the channel used. This value is used to identify the type of device that consumes the API and should to be configured in administrative web of BMATIC.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of branch requested.

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of service requested.

parameters.name: customer_id_type
parameters.description: Unique identifier of customer id type.

parameters.name: customer_id_number
parameters.description: Number of customer id.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Start time of booking.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: End time of booking.

get.description: Returns all bookings created by a specific customer, the bookings are sorted descendantly by the creation date.

parameters.name: customer_id_type
parameters.description: Unique identifier of customer id type.

parameters.name: customer_id_number
parameters.description: Number of customer id.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of booking.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Entity fields that will return at response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Position in pagination. Default is zero.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to retrieve. Default is 10, maximum is 50.

404.description: Non exists bookings that fulfill the filters.

get.description: Returns a customer booking by ID.

parameters.name: booking_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of booking.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Entity fields that will return at response.

delete.description: Delete a customer booking by ID.

parameters.name: booking_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of booking.

get.description: Returns a list of days for book a specific service in a branch. The days are sorted ascendantly.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of branch requested.

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of service requested.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Position in pagination. Default is zero.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to retrieve. Default is 10, maximum is 50.

post.description: Create a new customer ticket and then it returns it.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the channel used. This value is used to identify the type of device that consumes the API and should to be configured in administrative web of BMATIC.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of branch requested by customer.

parameters.name: sector_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of sector requested by customer.

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of service requested by customer.

parameters.name: customer_id_type
parameters.description: Unique identifier of customer id type.

parameters.name: customer_id_number
parameters.description: Number of customer id.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Customer phone for notifications.

get.description: Returns all tickets created by a specific customer, the tickets are sorted descendantly by the creation date.

parameters.name: customer_id_type
parameters.description: Unique identifier of customer id type.

parameters.name: customer_id_number
parameters.description: Number of customer id.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Entity fields that will return at response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Position in pagination. Default is zero.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to retrieve. Default is 10, maximum is 50.

404.description: Non exists tickets registered by the customer.

get.description: Returns a customer ticket by ID.

parameters.name: ticket_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of ticket.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Entity fields that will return at response.

put.description: Update a specific customer ticket(At least one parameter must be sent).

parameters.name: ticket_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of ticket.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Updated status of the ticket.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Updated of phone for notifications.

delete.description: Delete a customer ticket by ID.

parameters.name: ticket_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of ticket.

Error.description: HTTP body used when an error occurred.

message.description: A descriptive message regarding the exception.

code.description: An error code to find help for the exception.

more_info.description: The URL of BMatic's documentation for the error code. If the error code is undefined then this value is undefined too.

short_name.description: Short name of branch, used to display it in small devices.

code.description: Unique identifier for the branch used in your company system.

opening_time.description: Opening time of the branch at current day, or next opening datetime.

closing_time.description: Closing time of the branch at current day or next closing datetime.

low_estimated_time.description: Lower bound of the estimated waiting time. It is undefined when the branch is closed.

high_estimated_time.description: Upper bound of the estimated waiting time. It is undefined when the branch is closed.

congestion_level.description: Congestion level of the branch. It is undefined when the branch is closed.

is_virtual.description: Indicator of the possibility to create virtual tickets.

is_bookable.description: Indicator of the possibility to bookings.

short_name.description: Short name of sector, used to display it in small devices.

opening_time.description: Opening time of the sector at current day, or next opening datetime.

closing_time.description: Closing time of the sector at current day or next closing datetime.

short_name.description: Short name of service, used to display the service in small devices.

day.description: Day of time ranges with available bookings.

ranges.description: List of time ranges with available bookings

tags.name: Branch
tags.description: Operations for obtain branches and its sectors. They allow the use of many filter for help your application in the selection of the branch and sector in your own flow of tickets creation or bookings creation (The selection of sector is just required for booking creation).

tags.name: Service
tags.description: Operations for obtain the configured services. All operations allow the use of filters for help your application in the service selection.

tags.name: Booking
tags.description: Operations for obtain, create and delete customer bookings, and obtain the days with available bookings. All operations for obtaintion allow the use of filters.

tags.name: Ticket
tags.description: Operations for obtain, create, update and delete customer tickets. All operations for obtaintion allow the use of filters.
